info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 11 at 2:28PM PDT until October 13 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Spokane WA
info.description:
...SNOW FOR THE MOUNTAINS ACROSS EASTERN WASHINGTON AND NORTH IDAHO SUNDAY INTO MONDAY MORNING...
.A deep low pressure system will drop south across the Northwest Sunday into Sunday night. Moisture overrunning cold Canadian air will result in dropping snow levels with precipitation changing over to snow. Moderate to heavy snow is expected for higher elevations above 3000 feet in the Cascades, northern mountains of eastern Washington and north Idaho. Backcountry recreationalist should be prepared rapid changes in weather and winter weather conditions including winds producing cold wind chills in the teens to single digits.
* WHAT...Snow expected for elevations above 3000 feet. Total snow accumulations 0f 2 to 6 inches between 3000 to 4000 feet, and 6 to 12 inches above 4000 feet.
* WHERE...Holden Village and Stevens Pass.
* WHEN...From 8 AM Sunday to 11 AM PDT Monday.
* IMPACTS...Travel over mountain passes could be difficult. Backcountry recreationalist may experience a rapid degradation in weather conditions, and should be prepared for winter conditions through the night on Sunday. In addition, breezy winds in the mountains will lead to wind chill values in the teens.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM SUNDAY TO 11 AM PDT MONDAY FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 3000 FEET

area.areaDesc: Central Chelan County; Western Chelan County
